sen.j: 加藤 景正（かとう かげまさ、仁安 (日本)3年（1168年）? - 建長元年3月19日 (旧暦)（1249年5月3日）?）は、鎌倉時代前期の陶工で、瀬戸焼の祖とされる。
sen.e: Kakemasa KATO (1168 to May 3, 1249) was a potter during Kamakura period, and was regarded as the originator of Seto ware.
Kagemasa KATO (1168 to May 3, 1249) was a potter in the early Kamakura period, and was regarded as the originator of Seto ware.
sen.cmt: かげまさ Kakemasa → Kagemasa 鎌倉時代前期 during Kamakura period → in the early Kamakura period
sen.e: Kagemasa KATO (1168 to May 3, 1249) was a potter in the early Kamakura period, and was regarded as the originator of Seto ware.

sen.j: 通称は四郎左衛門（しろうざえもん）。
sen.e: He was commonly called Shirozaemon.
His common name was Shirozaemon.
sen.cmt: 表記統一に合わせて修正。
sen.e: His common name was Shirozaemon.

sen.j: これを略して藤四郎（とうしろう）とも呼ばれた。
sen.e: Or he was called Shiro for short.
He was also called Toshiro for short.
sen.cmt: or は不要のため削除し、alsoを追加。藤四郎（とうしろう）Shiro→Toshiroに修正。
sen.e: He was also called Toshiro for short.
His title was Shunkei.
His Go was Shunkei.
His Go was Shunkei.

sen.j: 加藤景廉の弟と伝わるが、その実像については不明な点が多い。
sen.e: Though it was rumored that he was a younger brother of Kagekado KATO, there were a lot of uncertain points about the real picture.
Although it is said that he was a younger brother of Kagekado KATO, there were a lot of uncertain points about his real picture.
sen.cmt: 伝わる it was rumored → it is said
sen.e: Although it is said that he was a younger brother of Kagekado KATO, there were a lot of uncertain points about his real picture.

sen.j: 一般的な説では、貞応2年（1223年）に道元とともに南宋に渡り、5年後に帰国の後、全国を放浪した後に尾張国の瀬戸で陶器に適した土を見つけて窯を開いたとされている。
sen.e: In a general theory, it is said that he crossed the sea to south Song in 1223 with Dogen, came back to his own country after five years, wandered around the whole country, discovered the soil that was appropriate for earthenware in Seto of Owari Province and opened the kiln.

In a general theory, it is said that he crossed the sea to south Song in 1223 with Dogen, came back to his own country after five years, wandered around the whole country, discovered the soil that was appropriate for earthenware in Seto of Owari Province and opened the kiln.

In a general theory, it is said that he crossed the sea to south Song in 1223 with Dogen, came back to his own country after five years, wandered around the whole country, discovered the soil that was appropriate for earthenware in Seto of Owari Province and opened the kiln.

sen.j: 子の加藤基通も藤四郎を名乗ってその家は12代にわたって続いたとされ、現在も愛知県瀬戸市には景正を祀った陶彦神社が存在する。
sen.e: It is said that, his child Motomichi KATO also introduced himself as Shiro Fuji, the house was succeeded in continuation for 12 generations, and even now in Aichi Prefecture Seto-shi City, Kakemasa is enshrined in an existing pottery shrine.

It is said that his child Motomichi KATO also introduced himself as Toshiro and that the house was succeeded for 12 generations, and even now in Seto City, Aichi Prefecture, there is Suehiko Jinjya Shrine which enshrines Kagemasa.
sen.cmt: 「in continuation」は不要のため削除。「愛知県瀬戸市」の英語表記を、表記統一に合わせて修正。「陶彦神社」の誤訳を修正。
sen.e: It is said that his child Motomichi KATO also introduced himself as Toshiro and that the house was succeeded for 12 generations, and even now in Seto City, Aichi Prefecture, there is Suehiko Jinjya Shrine which enshrines Kagemasa.

sen.j: その一方で、瀬戸で茶入が焼かれたのは室町時代であるとされ。
sen.e: On the other hand, it is assumed that the tea containers burnt in Seto belonged to Muromachi period.
On the other hand, it is assumed that baking tea containers in Seto was during Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: (陶器を）焼く burn→ bake。全体的にセンテンスを修正。
sen.e: On the other hand, it is assumed that baking tea containers in Seto was during Muromachi period.

sen.j: 景正の作品とされるものでも制作年代に疑問を持たれているものもある。
sen.e: Even if they were regarded as Kakemasa's masterpieces, the years of making of some were suspicious.
Even some of those which are regarded as his masterpieces are doubted about the year of making.
sen.cmt: 全体的にセンテンスを修正。
sen.e: Even some of those which are regarded as his masterpieces are doubted about the year of making.

sen.j: その一方で瀬戸で釉薬を用いた陶器製造が開始されたのは鎌倉時代前期にまで遡るとする発掘結果も報告されており、景正自身あるいはそのモデルとなった人物がこの時期に瀬戸焼の基礎を構築した可能性も否定は出来無いとされている。
sen.e: On the other hand, since there were also reports of excavation result that the beginning of earthenware manufacturing by the use of glaze in Seto can be traced back as early as the early Kamakura period, it cannot be denied that Kakemasa himself, or someone used Kakemasa as a model to build up the foundation of Seto ware during this period.

On the other hand, a result of excavation reported that the beginning of fabrication of earthenware using glaze in Seto goes back to the early Kamakura period, so the possibility that Kagemasa himself or someone else who acted as his role model built the foundation of Seto ware during this period is said to be impossible to deny.
sen.cmt: 全体的にセンテンスを修正。
sen.e: On the other hand, a result of excavation reported that the beginning of fabrication of earthenware using glaze in Seto goes back to the early Kamakura period, so the possibility that Kagemasa himself or someone else who acted as his role model built the foundation of Seto ware during this period is said to be impossible to deny.
